oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Miss Mary Hall interview: first teaching job
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hall,Mary
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Bullen, Bob, interviewer; Nunley, Joe, commentator
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mary Hall discusses her first teaching job after World War I in a one-teacher school house. Hall had two years of college work prior to taking the job. She taught twenty-five students from first to eighth grade. One of her students was "Red" Owens, a football player at Middle Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hall, Mary Ella, 1895-1991; Educators; Education; School buildings;
